column4: i am having trouble installing Ubuntu on a powerpc, anyone done this successfully?
Did you download the PowerPC version?
yes, it wont boot
you sure all the downing and burning went right?
i tried "boot:,/install/yaboot"  but it just gave me a error
about to try a different version
you sure all the downing and burning went right?
i cant fit the 9.10 powerpc image on one cd argggg
try either multi-session, dvd, or usb
usb on a mac g3?  thats tricky
dvd then
on a mac g3?
i hate typing your name, btw. anyway...perhaps i'm not familiar with the hardware you're working with. why wouldn't dvd work if cd would?
does open-firmware support dvd?  and type r0 then tab, auto complete. ;-)
I'm using X-Chat, that just displays those people in a readout. Anyway, I've honestly never heard of this open-frameware you speak of.
nm, r0k -> tab worked
Open firmware is apples version of a BIOS on the PowePC architecture
Oh! Um...you should simply have a boot from disc option, right? That doesn't specify DVD or CD...
i assume that you havent tried this before...
obviously. Hey, I'm going to get into a chat with one of my Mac friends and see if I can extract the info from him. I'll be back as soon as the quest is completed.
thanks, PM me k?
You got it.
